content:
Here is a sample gymnastics workout that you can follow to help you reach a full planche in 4 weeks:

Warm-up:

1. Jog around the gym or outside for 5-10 minutes to get your heart rate up and loosen up your muscles.
2. Spend 5-10 minutes stretching your major muscle groups, including your hamstrings, quadriceps, calves, hip flexors, and upper body.
3. Do some dynamic stretches, such as leg swings, arm circles, and high knees, to further prepare your body for activity.

Planche progressions:

1. Start with basic planche exercises, such as planche lean, planche tuck, and planche push-ups.
2. Gradually progress to more advanced planche exercises, such as planche lean to planche, tuck planche, and straddle planche.
3. Practice holding each position for 10-15 seconds, and aim to do 3-4 sets of each exercise.
4. As you get stronger, try to hold each position for longer periods of time and add more sets.
5. Don't forget to incorporate other upper body and core exercises, such as push-ups, dips, and planks, to help build the
